intro: Gynotroches axillaris, commonly known as the axillary gynotroche, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with hairy surfaces that provide a textured appearance. Gynotroches axillaris is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
